error.signature: UnboundLocalError: cannot access local variable 'x' referred to before assignment

verdict.summary: Variable referenced before assignment in local scope, often caused by reassigning a global/outer variable without nonlocal/global declaration.

dead_ends.action: Adding a try/except around the assignment
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the scoping issue; variable is still unbound on the failing path

dead_ends.action: Initializing the variable to None at function top
dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the real bug if the None path is never intended

workarounds.action: Add 'nonlocal' or 'global' declaration if intending to modify outer scope variable
workarounds.how: Use nonlocal x or global x at the top of the inner function

workarounds.action: Restructure to avoid shadowing â€” rename the local variable
workarounds.how: Use a different name for the local variable so it doesn't shadow the outer one
